intro: Cynanchum africanum, commonly known as African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a member of the Asclepiadaceae family, which includes other milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually yellow or greenish in color. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while the stem is woody and often branched.
